required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pemetrexed for the Treatment of Chordoma
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Pemetrexed for the Treatment of Chordoma

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, open-label, single-arm pilot feasibility study of pemetrexed for the treatment of adult patients with chordoma. All patients providing informed consent will be screened for eligibility. Eligible patients will receive pemetrexed by intravenous infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle, pre-medications (folic acid, vitamin B12, and dexamethasone), and ibuprofen if needed. Patients will continue dosing of pemetrexed until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, or treating physician determines it is in their best interest to stop. All patients will have regular evaluations for assessment of safety parameters and anti-tumor activity as detailed in the study flow chart.

primary_outcome.description: duration of time from start of treatment until objective tumor progression or withdrawal

primary_outcome.measure: Radiographic response assessed by RECIST v1.1
primary_outcome.description: rate of radiographic imaging alterations following treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Toxicity assessed by CTCAE v 4.03 criteria
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients experiencing adverse events

intervention.description: Pemetrexed 900 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Supportive medications of ibuprofen, folic acid, vitamin B12, and dexamethasone.
